question: As per Dashmani philosophy, how does a swami represent himself?
option1: through a harmony with the infinite vastness of nature
option2: through the attainment of supreme bliss through some divine quality or state
explanation: A swami represents himself through the attainment of supreme bliss through some divine quality or state (i.e. love, wisdom, service, yoga - i.e. Yogananda), and through harmony with the infinite vastness of nature, expressed in one of the ten subdivision names: Giri (mountain), Puri (tract), Bharati(land), Vana (forest), Ara?ya (forest), Sagara (sea), Asrama (spiritual exertion), Sarasvat? (wisdom of nature), T?rtha (place of pilgrimage), and Parvata (mountain).
